metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22997 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.1.2, kernel/module/decompress.c misinterprets the module_get_next_page return value (expects it to be NULL in the error case, whereas it is actually an error pointer). It was discovered that the module decompression implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle return values in certain error conditions. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2

No subscription required
